summary: This document is a U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) form providing warnings and assurances to an employee (Employee 26) being interviewed voluntarily as part of an investigation. The employee signs a waiver acknowledging the warnings and agreeing to provide information. The specific subject of the investigation is heavily redacted.

persons.name: Employee 26
persons.context: An individual identified as 'Employee 26' is the subject of a voluntary OIG interview, signs a waiver agreeing to provide information.

events.title: OIG Voluntary Interview
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary interview with Employee 26 as part of an investigation.

keyFacts: The document is a standard DOJ OIG form (OIG Form III-226/2) for voluntary employee interviews.
Employee 26 voluntarily agrees to be interviewed and provides a signed waiver.
The specific subject of the OIG investigation is completely redacted in the text.
The form states no disciplinary action will be taken if the employee chooses not to answer questions.
Any statements provided may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
